description:
Our unique three-bedroom in Lakeview has expansive common areas and cozy bedrooms that make it a delight for groups or families traveling together. We even have a pack n play for the youngest member of your family.

The massive patio provides even more area for socializing, and it's easily accessible to everything that Lakeview offers. Our place is a short 20 minutes to the Loop. We hope you'll love it - book today!

You walk up a private set of stairs with an open entrance to the living, dining, and kitchen space. The entire condo has 20 ft timber ceilings and exposed ductwork. You'll love our comfortable couch and vintage dining set! Just past the living and dining room are the floor-to-ceiling sliding glass doors to the patio. Opposite that is the galley kitchen, and beyond the kitchen is a hallway that leads to the bedrooms.

Total square footage of living space is 1,975 sqft with a 1,000 sqft deck.

You will have complete and private access to my apartment.

Lakeview is a lively neighborhood full of old Chicago charm. This apartment is perfect for groups who want to get away from the hustle and bustle of downtown while still having quick and convenient access to everything Chicago has to offer. The apartment is walking distance to the shops, restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. Guests can also easily explore the Roscoe Village and Lincoln Park neighborhoods. 

In general, Chicagoans are super nice, talkative, and helpful. Chicago is home, and you’ll feel always like one of our own.

Lakeview is the perfect location in Chicago. So enjoy!

5 minute walk from the nearest bus stop then to the subway that will take you all over the city (downtown and Wrigley). Otherwise, you’re a 10-15 minute Uber ride to downtown and a 21 minute Uber to O’Hare airport (no traffic). Everything is near you: Bucktown, WrigleyVille, Downtown, BoysTown, River North, etc.

description:
Enjoy this comfy, welcoming home with my dog Toby & I in the heart of this charming South suburb 30 mins. OUTSIDE OF Chicago. Enjoy great amenities while traveling for work or play. Walk to Metra station (to enjoy Chicago) limited on weekends. Great for couples, solo adventurers & business travelers. Great for med professionals : Christ, Palos, Little Co. of Mary Hospitals, Students: MVCC, Trinity Christian, St. Xavier; just 15 mins. from Midway Airport. Convenient to Parks, Shops & Restaurants.

These Private bedrooms offer a Queen size Bed and a Full size bed. Both beds feature a Spa Sensations Memory Foam Mattress (and a box spring) and 2 Gel Memory Foam Pillows and 2 Beautyrest Down Alternative Pillows available, which can accommodate up to two people in each room (for a total of 4), in the rooms you have rented. 

Enjoy the use of the following areas:
Shared Kitchen 
(note: there are some cooking limitations such as no cooking of onion, garlic, pesto or pungent odor foods and no cooking after 8pm, so please refer to house manual);
Shared Bathroom;
Front Porch Patio;
Back Patio with fire pit (please notify host BEFORE using - supervised); and
Street Parking available directly in FRONT of house

NOTE:  Outside Hose/water is NOT AVAILABLE for use.

Can use Kitchen, Bathroom as well as front porch patio and back patio.

I will be available to offer help throughout the stay.

Quiet, family friendly neighborhood.
Near Metra, Hospitals, Parks, Fitness Centers, Splash Park, Movie Theatre, Shopping Mall, Laundromat, Restaurants and close transportation:
Metra Train to Chicago, Pace Bus Service, and 15 minutes to Midway Airport. 

Great for Medical professionals close to: Christ Hospital / Palos Community Hospital / Little Co. of Mary Hospital

Great for students or parents visiting students at nearby schools/ colleges: MVCC / Trinity Christian / St. Xavier / Lewis University as well as several others nearby.

Neighborhood Parks, Malls, Restaurants & Bars
Wolfe Wildlife Refuge with paved walking trail
Lake Katherine Waterfall Park with wood chips walking trail 
Train to Downtown Chicago
Close to several major hospitals, colleges and two universities

UBER or LYFT or private taxi service is available.  

Public Transportation within a couple of blocks walking distance:  

Train:  SW Service Metra Service (Downtown Chicago to Manhattan) Chicago Ridge Station within walking distance from home (schedule in photos) although it is very limited on weekends, but there is the Orange Line that is just 15 mins away. 

Pace Bus Service: 
6 Connecting Routes Service Chicago Ridge
Route 384 (comes from Midway Airport)
Route 385 (comes from Midway Airport and goes to Moraine Valley Valley Comm College) 
Both Pace Routes 384 & 385 are within walking distance to home and connect to other Routes (maps in photos)

description:
Welcome to our sunny condo--a roomy, vintage space with a modern, artsy vibe--in lively,  lovely Oak Park. We are just 2 blocks from Forest Park's bustling shops and restaurants (try The Heritage for brunch!), and a 10 min walk to Metra, Green Line,  Blue Line (all a 30 min ride to downtown Chicago), and downtown Oak Park.  Located just off I-290, we have private parking and are a 2 minute drive to Whole Foods and lots of local shopping and restaurants in downtown Oak Park. Smoke free/pet free.

Located on the top/3rd floor of an early 1900's classic brick apartment building with private rear entrance. (Sorry, no elevator!)

Help yourself to a mug of tea and light breakfast in the morning in our sunny gathering space, or head out to one of many great brunch locations on the weekend.

The plant and light-filled condo is furnished with a clean, relaxing palette and a few of our hand-made tables and artworks throughout the home. 

The bedroom includes a twin size bed and twin size trundle bed. (Due to their different heights, they don't push together to make a queen size--sorry.) There are also 2 couches in different common spaces. A queen size double high air mattress (with a built-in pump that can inflate or deflate to whatever firmness you prefer) is available upon request. 

There are ceiling fans in each room and ac window units available from May to September. There is a laundromat located across the street. You'll find essentials such as shampoo (paraben and fragrance free, vegan), towels, sheets, cookware,  hair dryer, iron, first aid kit. 

We don't charge a big cleaning fee because we're counting on you to leave the place the way you found it. :)

Great location to get away from the intensity of the Loop while still having quick access to downtown Chicago by car or public transportation. We are located on a side street near the border of Forest Park and Oak Park, a bustling commercial area. Oak Park is home to more Frank Lloyd Wright buildings than any other village, Earnest Hemingway's birthplace and museum,  lots of great community events, and tons of great shopping and dining. 

During the summer, check out World Music Thursdays from 5-9 on North Marion, free movie nights in Scoville Park, and the Oak Park Farmers Market  every Saturday morning at the corner of Lake and N Elmwood. 

During the winter, there is plenty of great shopping, holiday events, our massive public library, and $5 Movie Tuesdays at Lake Theatre.  

You'll find a wide variety of restaurants nearby including Thai, Mexican, Chinese, Israeli, Indian, Greek, Italian, bakeries, sushi, breweries, Chicago-style pizza, and more. Our favorite local spots are The Heritage (a quick walk) and Citrine for dinner, brunch, and cocktails and Spilt Milk for biscuits and breakfast, oh and pie. Our local food Co-Op, the Sugar Beet, is just a few blocks away. Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Target are a quick drive  and there are many great shops downtown including a fantastic book shop.

If you plan to take the Green Line into the city (my preference), I recommend a pit-stop at the Garfield Park Conservatory, a free and beautiful indoor garden space full of lush exotic plants, flowers, and even a few waterfalls. (Oak Park also has a small conservatory if you're looking for something in-town on a rainy day.) 

Also off the Green Line is the dining district of the West Loop (Morgan stop). For burger gurus, we recommend Au Cheval, though you might need to wait for a table. For veg and vegan options, we love Bad Hunter. Another popular spot in that area is The Girl and the Goat (reservations recommended) or their sister restaurant Little Goat Diner. For some cheap eats, Do Rite Donuts has great donuts including a few vegan and gluten free options, along with a smattering of tasty chicken sandwiches.

Heading downtown? Try a Chicago Architecture River Cruise or take the much cheaper Water Taxi for some sightseeing. Stop in for a bite or a drink at The Kitchen, right on the river. 

In addition to the famed Art Institute, check out the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago, The Museum of Contemporary Photography (free!), and the Chicago Cultural Center (free!).

There is so much within a 1 to 15 minute walk from this apartment.  The Metra train (10 minute walk) and CTA Green Line or Blue Line train (10 minute walk) will take you into downtown Chicago in 25-30 minutes. The Metra station in the Loop (Ogilvie) has connections to Amtrak trains. Short uber/lyft ride from O'Hare and Midway airports (depending on traffic). There are a few Zip Cars a few blocks away if you just need a car for a few hours.

Overnight parking is not permitted in the village of Oak Park without a pass or permit, but we sometimes have private parking available. Please contact me if you are planning to bring a vehicle.

We are a pet-free place, not because we don't love furry friends, but because of our allergies to dogs and cats. We are a kid-free place because there are lots of plants, books, artwork, cabinets, outlets at kid level and a 3rd floor patio that we don't feel would be the best for kids.

Parking is tricky in Oak Park, but we sometimes have designated parking spaces available. Please let us know if you will be bringing a vehicle so we can help secure parking. If there is snow, you will need to shovel out your car. Shovels are available on deck for your use.

This is a third floor apartment with no elevator.

Because this is a vintage building with old pipes, there is sometimes a short bit of rusty water when you first turn on the tub faucet. 

There is no condo access to the thermostat.

We have a comfy room in our home that is available for budget travlers/guests. This is for a room is a private room with a bed, closet and desk. Great central location. 5 minutes walking to the blue line, and a 15 minute ride into the city. Logan Square is home to the best bars & coffee shops in Chicago. Variety of places to eat in all directions walking distance. If you want to explore other areas of Chicago, We'll tell you all the good sights to see and eat.

Let's be honest. Traveling isn't cheap. Hotels and hostels can be expensive. Especially in Chicago. A cheaper option is Airbnb. Perfect for the younger budget travlers.

Usually people under the age of 40 book with us. We recommend that you be under 35. For a better stay and environment. We offer our single room to good use for our guests. 

We try to keep clean; to be honest we do our best but if you're a clean freak or can't handle a little mess don't book with us. It can be noisy since we love to bump to good music and watch movies. The roomies hang out on the back deck outside at the table and chit chat.

We offer cheap living arrangements for budget travelers. You won't find prices like ours. We aren't the Marriott/Hilton/Ritz Carlton hotels, we're working 20 year old's with busy schedules, and sometimes cleaning isn't a priority. Please read all reviews before booking.

description:
Enjoy all the comforts of home in your top floor 3 bedroom apartment in a classic Chicago walk-up situated in beautiful Logan Square. When you're not exploring all that Chicago has to offer, you'll appreciate the warm, inviting decor and brand new furniture! Enjoy the space on your own or socialize with guests in other units the oversized backyard! We know you'll love staying with here!

As you enter through the front door, you’ll take the stairs up the right to your own private apartment on the 3rd floor, complete with brand new smart locks so you never have to worry about keys. The living room has all the modern amenities you’ll need. Two large sofas give you plenty of room to spread out and relax while watching your favorite streaming TV show on our 50” Roku flatscreen. When’s it’s time to eat or play a game, you’ll find plenty of space around our dining room table in the kitchen.

Speaking of eating, our kitchen is fully stocked with everything you need to make you feel at home:
- Full table settings including plates, bowls, glassware and silverware
- Lots of wine glasses!
- Pots, pans and culinary knife set
- Gas range oven, microwave and toaster
- Coffee Maker with free coffee!

If you head out the back door, you’ll have plenty of open space for storage or keeping shoes on the covered porch. Head down the porch stairs and you’ll be taken to our massive backyard.

Tired from your long day? Each bedroom has side tables and alarm clocks with integrated USB charges, a full-sized mirror, closet with hangers and a dresser so you can unpack and relax. All beds have memory foam mattresses, microfiber sheets, multiple pillows and a cozy comforter and blanket to help you dream those sweet dreams. Bedrooms 1 and 2 each have a twin bed and bedroom 3 has one queen. If you need more room, the sofa in the living room facing the TV has a full-sized pullout bed.

The bathroom was recently updated and has a full shower and bath. You’ll find towels, extra linens and free soap/shampoo for your use. Other amenities include free high speed WIFI, an iron and ironing board, hair dryer and integrated smart locks at every entrance.

Enjoy your time outdoors as we’re just steps away from scenic Humboldt Park to the South and the famous Chicago 606 bike path to the North. Or, stay closer to the house and enjoy our expansive backyard on the oversized lot! A quick 10 minute walk north will bring you to some of Logan’s best bars and restaurants and downtown Chicago is only a quick car or train ride away. You have the best of both worlds with us! Local flavor in an historic neighborhood while keeping quick access to the best that downtown Chicago has to offer.

There's plenty of great spots within walking distance. There's a great walking and biking trail 3 minutes up the street and plenty of nature to explore in nearby Humboldt Park. If you you want to travel into the city, there's a bus stop just a quick 3 minute walk from the house that will bring you to the El (subway) station about a mile down the road. From there it's a quick 10 minute ride righto the heart of downtown!

description:
New to the market-  this completely renovated apartment sits atop our Bath and Body workshop. Our small business began in our home 8 years ago and in 2016 it became too big to stay there.  We bought this run down corner store building that sits on a double lot on a neighborhood street in south Berwyn.  Over the next year, we completely renovated the building.  The first floor is the home to our e-commerce business.  The second floor was built with the traveller's needs in mind.

This apartment is a bright, sunny happy place. Decorated with chicago themed details and goods from local artists and crafters. We keep it very clean and organized for your enjoyment. Our guests have complete and private access to the second floor. Two driveway parking spaces and a large backyard are also for your use. We have a bike rack where guests can lock up their bikes or borrow ours (if arranged) to explore the neighborhood. Berwyn is full of traditional chicago brick bungalow homes built in the 1920s. It boasts the largest collection of these homes in the nation. 

The apartment has many amenities - a new large washer and dryer. Perfect for guests on road trips that would like to cleanup before heading out. Cable, Netflix, game console all for your use. Toiletries, laundry supplies , snacks, light breakfast food and coffee are all complimentary.

8 miles to the chicago loop. Accessible to public transportation. 2 miles to Brookfield Zoo and historic Oak Park. Close to shopping, live music, old school bakery. 

The first floor of this building houses Berwyn Bettys Bath & Body’s workshop (berwynbettys.com) a community based mission business. Tour can be arranged. In the future look for destination classes offered.

Guests have full access to the second floor of the building and the backyard.  Driveway and bike rack are for guest use as well. If interested in touring the Berwyn Betty Bath Bomb workshop on the first floor, guests are welcome to arrange this.  In the future we hope to offer bath product making excursions.  Learn to make products downstairs and stay as our guest upstairs.

Berwyn is a diverse community on the near West side of Chicago. We are a suburb "on the grid" that is known for our eccentricities and vibrant art and music scenes. We have the "Velt", which are the various clubs on Roosevelt Ave. and Rt. 66 running through our town. We are perfectly situated in the center of all of what makes Chicago-land unique.

Apartment is on a quiet neighborhood street.  Easy public bus access two blocks away.  One mile from the Metra train to Chicago Union Station (20 minute train ride).  A mile and a half from the CTA Blue line (to downtown and O'Hare airport).

Absolutely no pets.  We are happy to recommend pet boarding options.  If you show up with a pet, you will be asked to leave.

additional_house_rules:
BANGTEL Welcomes You and Your Group

EARLY CHECK-IN / LATE CHECK-OUT
May be possible pending availability. Rates are as follows:
1-3 hours of standard check-in/check-out time $50
3+ hours subject to a half day rate or standard $125

CHECK-OUT TIME
Check-out time is prompt at 11 AM.  We would love to let you stay forever, but the issue is we have someone checking in right after you.  If you have not been approved for a late check-out, you will be subject to a $50 fine each 15 minute interval that you delay the Cleaning Team.  We value our Cleaner's Team time and work and hope you do as well.  A delayed checkout only causes stress and extra work for them.   We hope you understand, so please make sure to check out on time in order to avoid any fine.  If a late checkout time is mandatory, please make sure to make arrangements upon booking.  We will do our best to accommodate your request pending availability.  

SECURITY 
Must provide copy of photo ID upon booking via the message center or via email to stay@bangtel.com  
PHOTOSHOOTS/FILMS
If you are booking for a Photoshoot or Production, we have special rates for you and all shoots must be approved prior to booking.  

PARTIES / EVENTS
Additional refundable security deposit will be taken for parties and events.  

Additional fees apply for any guests over the maximum allowed number of guests on the listing.  Parties and event fees are based on a case by case basis, number of guests, and duration of the event. 

PARTY GLITTER & CONFETTI FEE
Those small little shiny fun circles are not fun at all for our cleaning team to pick up.  They are actually a nightmare for the clean-up team and we politely warn you that there will be an additional fee for sprinkling glitter or confetti.  Please note, you are more than welcome to wear that lovely sequined jumpsuit, by all means bring it to the party. ;-)

SHOES
No matter how fabulous your shoes are we do ask that you PLEASE remove them when in the house.

FLOORING
PLEASE only use the Rubio Monocoat to clean or wipe the floors on the third floor.  The cleaner is clearly labeled and located in a spray bottle under the kitchen sink. 
 
NO SMOKING PLEASE
There is absolutely no smoking allowed in the unit.  You are welcome to smoke outside, but please dispose in the provided ashtrays. There is a $500 fine for smoking in the unit.

PETS
Can be allowed with approval prior to your stay and costs $125 pet fee per pet.  A portion of the pet fee goes to support The Hit Living Foundation, a charity that supports animal and human welfare.  

CHECKOUT INSTRUCTIONS / CLEANUP
Please clean up and discard all your trash prior to your departure.  
Please also shut and lock all doors and windows. 

EVERYDAY IS EARTH DAY 
We kindly ask that you turn the lights out daily when you leave for the day during your stay, turn the air con up or heat down, and recycle.  If you are cranking the air con, by all means enjoy, but please make sure the windows are closed.   
We have large recycle bins for your use and directives on the refrigerators, so you can see what is recyclable.

description:
Take over this original Historic remodeled palatial two-story Brownstone in the heart of Lincoln Park, Chicago.  Located right on the infamous Clark Street across from the Lincoln Park Zoo and just steps to Lake Michigan, there will be no complaints about the central location of BANGTEL's Mr. Clark's Family.  Stay with everyone, family and friends, all under one very spacious roof giving you privacy and intimacy when you require it.  This modern, sunlit space will have your group feeling good.

Double the fun with two living areas and two kitchens.  Need a little privacy from your mother-in-law, nanny, or a loud "Snorer" in the group?  Book this combination for the best feeling of spaciousness and privacy.

You have access to the entire two apartments, private back wooden porch spaces, and parking for one SUV or two small compact vehicles (when parked one behind the other).

We encourage you to text, call, or message us on the Airbnb app with any issues or questions.

The neighborhood could not be more conveniently located.  This location in Lincoln Park is next to Lake Michigan and the Lincoln Park Zoo, award winning restaurants, and great local bars.  Mr. Clark's is just a short walk to the Magnificent Mile as well for the infamous shopping and eating of Chicago.  To get to Chicago's Loop or McCormick Place Convention Center, it is a 15 minute drive or taxi.

Download the Uber or Lyft app for swift pick-up or drop-off needs. 
Parking is onsite for one large size SUV or vehicle.  Two compact cars may fit one behind the other (tandem style) behind the unit. We recommend the Spot Hero app for parking for additional spaces in the area.

description:
Cozy 2 bdrm in the heart of Lil Mexico in Chicago. Get to experience what it really means to be a chicagoan. Enjoy the amazing food the city & the neighborhood have to offer. :)

Brand New, just upadated, Cozy 2 bdrm in Little Mexico. The rental is for an entire apartment. Living Room, Kitchen, 2 bedrooms and a small room with a desk.

This is for the entire apartment. :)

We love talking to our guests and we love showing them around town! We do have a very busy work schedule and are not always able to show people around town and sometimes we even come home exhausted and just wanna plummet unto our bed. Of course we understand travelers do feel that way too. We will of course greet you when you come in and show you where everything is!

Little Village is an amazing working class neighborhood filled with amazing people who come predominantly from Mexico. Needless to say, it is Chicago's "Little Mexico" and has a culture unto its own which makes it unique from all other Chicago neighborhoods and is especially different (positively so) from the Loop and Downtown areas. It's filled with families and you'll often see kids playing on the streets throughout the day. In the summer and fall it is vibrant with music festivals, community events, and big cultural "Ferias" that celebrate Mexican culture, history, food, and people.

26th Street is Little Village's economic center and it is a wonderful contrast to Downtown's "Magnificent Mile." Filled with mom and pop shops, bakeries, food, and beyond. It will transport you to Latin America. Take a day to walk down the 2 mile stretch of local businesses and make sure to make a few rest stops at the local bakeries, and taquerias.

We are close to main highways.

Train: The elevated (L) train pink line is less than a ten minute walk away and takes you to the center of downtown (loop) in about 20 minutes.

Bus: The 60 bus is a 24hr bus that runs through the length of the neighborhood's main street (26th st), then through the heart of Pilsen and gets you to Union Station and millennium park. This bus is a 1-2 minute walk from the house.

The 21 bus takes you through Cermak road all the way to McCormick convention place. It's a 3 minute walk from the house.

The 53 Pulaski bus takes you the north side neighborhoods of the city (Humboldt park, logan square, Albany Park) and is also a convenient way of getting to the train without walking. It's located on the corner of our block.

Bike: Chicago is a very bike-friendly city and we are bike crazies ourselves. We can provide you with a free bike map of the city if you need it.

Walk: take a day to walk down the length of 26th st. in Little Village. It's worth it.

Fly: the nearest airport is Midway (15 min. cab or car drive). Ohare international airport is about a 30min-1 hour drive away. Both airports are accessible by train and buses that can get you to our house in about 40minutes-1:30hours.

Swim: Lake Michigan is cold. Don't do that...

This women's residence in a 115 yr.old 2 story brick house on near west side of Chicago is close to downtown and only 2 short blocks west of the Kedzie stop on the pink line. It is easy to get all over from here!
The place is totally furnished even with linens, dishes, towels, pans, etc. There are 4 bedrooms, a sitting room, kitchen, bathroom, deck off kitchen on 2nd floor. 
On the 1st floor is a bathroom, small art gallery/lounge, an office, and my room in the back. There is also an extra bedroom on 1st floor should all rooms fill upstairs! (Paris Room)
On the lower level- there is an art studio and laundry area. We have a large garden for flowers and relaxing with nature outside.
I have 3 dogs named Billy Bob, Wayne, & Glenn who stay with me on 1st floor. They don't go to second floor. There is no smoking inside the building. 
We have a very secure building in a residential neighborhood. We have been here for 12 years at this location. I have been renting rooms to women since 1982! Only trustworthy and kind women rent here. 
Is that you?! 
Please visit the website and then ask your questions via email. www.urbanartretreat.com    contact@urbanartretreat.com
sincerely, Dianna

everything but my private space

I stay in background but can answer questions if you have some. I can help you with public transportation. We have periodic house meetings.

Friendly African American neighborhood with plenty of walking space. People say hello here! Say hello back, or even first. This is a very urban environment.  This part of the neighborhood is friendly, people are nice, and things are o.k. even though not each house is picturesque. We have been located here 12 years without incidents. How many people can say that?! Neighbors know we are here, we teach their kids, we all look out for each other. We feel safe.

Just 2 blocks from here is pink line train- connects to everywhere and goes right downtown! Pete's Fresh Market is on Cermak (take #21 bus east) is not far, and has best and cheapest fresh produce. Lots of Mexican food restaurants one block away on Cermak. There is one Chinese Food place on Cermak walking distance. Can take #21 bus to Chinatown. Douglas Park is huge and has a track and outdoor swimming pool. Walking distance. Also has a lagoon. Plenty of fish and fowl. Can take pink line train downtown to many free and cultural stuff. Get off at Randolph and Cultural Center is right there- go in and check it out and go to visitors center too.

access: Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.
description:
Welcome to Windy City!

This lovely 2 BR/1BA apartment is located at the center of Chicago. You will find the best restaurants, shopping stores nearby! Popular tourists destinations are just a walk away!

The apartment includes one full bathroom, with a shower, sink, and toilet. We’re all about helping you look (and smell) your best, so we provide shampoo, conditioner, and body wash in addition to hand soap and fluffy towels. Trust us when we say there’s no better way to warm up after a Windy City walk than a hot shower!

There’s ample space for guests to relax on the sofa and watch on a large flat-screen TV. Like the rest of the unit, you’ll live it up in luxury among hardwood floors and contemporary decor. The entire place has free, fast WiFi and Chicago sunshine streaming in through the windows.

Whether you’re craving a home-cooked meal or just somewhere to put the box of deep-dish, our kitchen is fully stocked with cookware, dishes, utensils, and has swanky granite countertops. Appliances include a full-sized fridge and freezer, gas stove, oven, microwave, toaster, and coffee maker. The only things missing are your favorite farmer’s market finds!!

Ever dreamed about jetting off to your own Chicago apartment? Well, now’s your chance to bring that fantasy to life. During your stay, the whole apartment is yours and only yours.

We’re all about giving you plenty of privacy and personal space, so we’ll be available by phone (call or text) during your stay.

Make sure to wear stretchy pants and spoil yourself with Logan Square’s myriad selection of drinks and grub! For Asian comfort food, Fat Rice has a great menu of comfort food from the far east. If you want something fresh from the farm to the table, Lulu’s Café is a local favorite. Satisfy your sweet tooth with pies from Bang Bang Pie Shop and candies plus hot choco at Katherine Ann Confections. If you’re looking to explore our bustling nightlife after a day of visiting our many art hubs, drop by Slippery Slope or Logan Arcade to chug a good mug of beer.

Being a walkable enclave, you’re sure to find something great at Logan Square whatever tickles your fancy. The Red Line is also accessible from the property in case you want to step your Chicago tour up a notch.

-Bath towels are provided per number of guest not per number of stay
-Washcloths are not provided during your stay. You may send me a message though if you need them and I'll try my best to accommodate your request.
-We have duvet covers on our beddings  (no top sheets).
-A Security Deposit may be required on some bookings. 
-If there's an issue during your stay, please report it real time so we can address it right away.

You'll love it! Elegant vintage apartment with high ceilings and filled with sunlight. Walking distance to the CTA Brown Line Damen stop, nearby parks, and Lincoln Square cafés and shopping. Close to Wrigley Field. Very safe neighborhood. LGBTQ and POC welcome. Happy to communicate in English, Italian, Spanish, German and French. I look forward to hosting you.

You are welcome to use all the shared areas of the apartment, open the French doors onto the living room and read a book on the sofa in the sunshine, eat or work in the dining room, cook and make coffee in the kitchen, take your morning coffee and newspaper to the back porch.

I am available to help with suggestions about what to do, where to go, and how to get there in this wonderful city of Chicago. I love to eat so I have a lot of recommendations for best restaurants in the neighborhood and in the whole city.

Hands down one of the best neighborhoods in the city, combining quiet residential streets and charming districts with cafes, restaurants, shopping and parks.

Easily accessible via Uber, public transport and easy street parking.

Light sleepers: the nearby train can be heard from the bedroom, though the AC drowns out most of its sound. In fall and winter with closed windows, it is not noticeable. Personally I find the train sound soothing. 
3rd floor apartment with no elevator. It's a good workout!

description:
1,350 Sq. Ft sun drenched corner loft with 2 bed/2 bath in the landmark district of Wicker Park. Late 1800's building formerly home to a wallpaper distribution company. Converted in 2001, this beautiful unit has exposed brick supporting 10' high windows which line the entire NE side and oak floors throughout with carpeted bedrooms.

Walk around to lots of great eateries and bars. And when you're tired of walking, relax on the balcony with a drink and just people-watch in the heart of Wicker Park. You'll feel like you're with the crowd but from the comfort of your very own chair.

15 minutes away from the heart of downtown by the blue line and 40 minutes from the airport, which makes it perfect for business travelers, large groups and families (with kids).

description:
Welcome to my 3-story historic landmark Evanston home w/3 rooms to choose from 2.5 blocks from CTA and 5 blocks from Metra. Ideal for Northwestern Univ - related business or family affairs w/multi-room needs.  Self-serve breakfast included. Use dining, living rooms, backyard, board games, tons of books. Wifi is strong anywhere in the house. Close to Downtown Evanston, 80+ restaurants, Union Pizzeria & Space for musical acts and good eats at Hewn artisan bakery. 15-minute walk to Lake Michigan.

The 3-story home is one unit of a landmarked Holabird and Roche row-house built in 1892  located in a quiet, tree-filled neighborhood full of beautiful historic churches and homes. 
This room is on the third floor with private bath and will have a king-size bed with both seating and work areas. 
Out of respect for our neighbors and other guests, we lock the door at 11:30p unless special arrangements have been made in advance.
Dogs are fine with prior discussion, NO cats allowed due to allergies.

I am around most of the time and available to my guests at all times by phone or messaging. I enjoy chatting with guests, yet realize that it is unlikely that they came to stay to visit with me :-).
As a life-long resident of the area, I am happy to share my knowledge and to give recommendations.

Home is on a quiet, tree-lined street with a park just a block away. Many other historic homes and churches within walking distance. Lake Michigan is just 3/4 mile away with beaches, parks, and biking and walking paths. There are Trader Joes and Jewel/Osco stores approximately 1/4 mile from the house as is Hewn, an artisan bakery that guests rave about. Many fine restaurants  and unique boutiques are within walking distance. Approximately 1.25 miles from Northwestern University.

You can get to anywhere around Evanston and the city of Chicago from the Dempster Street purple line (2.5 blocks)and Davis Metra (5 blocks) stops which are within easy walking distance. Evanston has over 80 restaurants covering almost any ethnic food you could desire.

The bus route 250 which travels to and from O’Hare airport has a stop at the Davis St. (5 blocks). Ample free street parking is available on the blocks surrounding the house.

description:
Unbelievable location in Old Town with tons of space, 2 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, and outdoor patio space. 2 queen beds, 2 sofa beds, a huge (and very comfortable) L couch, and 3 air mattresses are provided.

Our place is truly close to everything. Steps away from an L stop, world class dining & entertainment on Wells Street, Lincoln Park, and North Avenue beach. A 95 Walk Score!

This is a single floor unit with the absolute best location. It is less than a 2 minute walk from the Sedgwick Brown Line, which makes visiting the city quick and affordable.

The thing that I enjoy most about this location is the proximity to the restaurants and entertainment in Old Town. My favorite Italian restaurant in the city, Topo Gigio, is located on Wells Street. If Italian isn't your thing, there are many other very popular restaurants and bars located on Wells Street. Also, the world famous Second City Comedy Club is right down the street. Check out the people who got their start at Second City! I highly recommend checking out a show.

There is 1 oversized master bedroom with en suite full bathroom. There is also a twin bed, sofa bed, and 2 air mattresses in the den portion of the master bedroom. The second bedroom is simple but offers a queen bed as well. The second bathroom is located in the hallway, which makes it convenient for all guests to have access. There is also a full kitchen with barstool seating for 3, outdoor patio seating for 6, and a huge living room. There is a 46'' Samsung TV and a huge and comfortable couch.

Important Notes :

Please keep in mind this is not a vacant house - this is our part time home where we reside when not traveling for work. We always have the unit professionally cleaned prior to guests staying, and put our items away as best as we can. Definitely not a brand new property but it is clean, comfortable, and spacious. Probably not well suited for anyone looking for a 5 star luxury hotel.

Please be aware that we have a strict no party policy. While our house is able to host large groups, we expect you to treat this home respectfully and obey all house rules (no smoking, no excessive noise, no outside guests, and clean up after yourselves). We expect you to take the party to the bars and only use our place as a spot to hang out, cook, and sleep. There is another unit above us with full-time residents who work during the week and are very sensitive to noise. We will charge the appropriate amount after your stay if additional cleaning is required, evidence of smoking in the house is found, or damage is done to the house. Thank you in advance!
